titles.title: Carson National Forest Boundary Adjustment Act of 2013
Carson National Forest Boundary Adjustment Act of 2013
A bill to adjust the boundary of the Carson National Forest, New Mexico.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on Public Lands, Forests, and Mining. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 113-28.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Wyden without amendment. With written report No. 113-58.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 112.

bill.summary: 6/27/2013--Reported to Senate without amendment. Carson National Forest Boundary Adjustment Act of 2013 - Adjusts the boundary of the Carson National Forest in New Mexico to incorporate approximately 4,990 acres of land identified as the Miranda Canyon Boundary.
